SEARCH
Package util

Class CSVUtil

java.lang.Object
util.CSVUtil
public class CSVUtil extends Object
Utility class for CSV file operations in the Internship Placement Management System.

This class provides thread-safe methods for reading from and writing to CSV files, which serve as the data storage mechanism for the application (as per assignment requirements, no databases are allowed).

Key Features:

  • Read all records from CSV files
  • Write complete datasets to CSV files
  • Append single records to existing CSV files
  • Validate CSV file headers
  • Count rows in CSV files
  • Create CSV files if they don't exist

Thread Safety: All methods are synchronized to prevent concurrent modification issues when multiple users access the system.

Since:
2025-10-14
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
SC2002 SCED Group-6

  • Constructor Details

    • CSVUtil

      private CSVUtil()
      Private constructor to prevent instantiation. This is a utility class with only static methods.

  • Method Details

    • readCSV

      public static List<String[]> readCSV(String filePath) throws IOException
      Reads all records from a CSV file.

      Returns a list of string arrays, where each array represents one row in the CSV file. The first row typically contains headers.

      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file to read
      Returns:
      a list of string arrays representing all rows in the file
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be read

    • writeCSV

      public static void writeCSV(String filePath, List<String[]> data) throws IOException
      Writes a complete dataset to a CSV file, overwriting any existing content.

      The first row in the data list should contain column headers. All existing content in the file will be replaced.

      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file to write
      data - the list of string arrays to write (including headers as first row)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be written

    • appendToCSV

      public static void appendToCSV(String filePath, String[] record, String[] headers) throws IOException
      Appends a single record to an existing CSV file.

      If the file doesn't exist, it will be created. If headers are provided and the file is empty, headers will be written first.

      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      record - the string array representing one row to append
      headers - optional headers to write if file is new (can be null)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be written

    • validateHeaders

      public static boolean validateHeaders(String filePath, String[] expectedHeaders) throws IOException
      Validates that a CSV file has the expected headers.

      Compares the first row of the CSV file with the expected headers. Comparison is case-insensitive and ignores leading/trailing whitespace.

      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      expectedHeaders - the expected column headers
      Returns:
      true if headers match, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be read

    • countRows

      public static int countRows(String filePath) throws IOException
      Counts the number of rows in a CSV file (excluding the header row).
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      Returns:
      the number of data rows (total rows minus header)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be read

    • fileExistsAndNotEmpty

      public static boolean fileExistsAndNotEmpty(String filePath)
      Checks if a CSV file exists and is not empty.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      Returns:
      true if file exists and has content, false otherwise

    • ensureFileWithHeaders

      public static void ensureFileWithHeaders(String filePath, String[] headers) throws IOException
      Ensures a CSV file exists with the specified headers.

      If the file doesn't exist or is empty, it will be created with the provided headers. If the file exists with content, no action is taken.

      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      headers - the column headers to write
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be created or written

    • readDataRows

      public static List<String[]> readDataRows(String filePath) throws IOException
      Reads all data rows from a CSV file (excluding the header row).
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      Returns:
      a list of string arrays representing data rows only
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be read

    • findRowsByColumnValue

      public static List<String[]> findRowsByColumnValue(String filePath, int columnIndex, String searchValue) throws IOException
      Searches for rows in a CSV file that match a specific value in a column.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      columnIndex - the index of the column to search (0-based, excluding header)
      searchValue - the value to search for
      Returns:
      a list of matching rows (excluding header)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be read

    • deleteRowByIdentifier

      public static boolean deleteRowByIdentifier(String filePath, int columnIndex, String identifier) throws IOException
      Deletes a row from a CSV file based on a unique identifier in a specific column.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      columnIndex - the index of the column containing the unique identifier
      identifier - the identifier of the row to delete
      Returns:
      true if a row was deleted, false if not found
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be read or written

    • updateRowByIdentifier

      public static boolean updateRowByIdentifier(String filePath, int columnIndex, String identifier, String[] newRow) throws IOException
      Updates a row in a CSV file based on a unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      columnIndex - the index of the column containing the unique identifier
      identifier - the identifier of the row to update
      newRow - the new data for the row
      Returns:
      true if a row was updated, false if not found
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be read or written
